results.title: Detect and protect
results.brief_description: The basic elements of the drug story. How do you spot whether or not your child, or any other child is using drugs? What are the tell-tale emotional changes to watch for? What are the various types of drugs and which are the most dangerous? How do you protect the youngsters against becoming part of the drug scene> This film answers these questions simply.

results.title: Det Sjunde inseglet = The Seventh seal
results.brief_description:
The title refers to God’s book of secrets in which the greatest gift, the secret of life, will be revealed only after the breaking of the seventh seal. In this film which Bergman calls an oratorio, and The Virgin Spring (1959) he tried to purge the uglier aspects of religious practice as well as confront the silence of God in the face of what he saw an ‘an active evil’. The Seventh Seal is a morality play set in doom-laden 14th century Sweden. Although in some ways the film’s psychological and erotic concerns are modern and the world weary knight who challenges Death to a game of chess is a distinctly modern hero, Bergman chose the medieval period for the way in which thought was then embodied iconographically, providing the basis for the film’s striking imagery. Also available on VHS and LD.

Credits: Director, Ingmar Bergman ; photographer, Gunnar Fischer ; production designer, P.A. Lundgren ; music, Erik Nordgren.
Cast: Gunnar Bjornstrand, Benyt Ekerot, Nils Poppe, Max Von Sydow, Bibi Anderson.

results.title: Destruction Derby
results.brief_description: In this animated fable with no narration, a caveman builds a car and soon the whole planet is overrun with cars, trucks and airplanes and the air choked with polluting fumes. The imaginative cartoon focuses on one aspect of destruction to the environment and offers a tongue-in-cheek solution - send all cars off in a rocket, into outer space.

results.title: Destiny's Angel
results.creator_credit: Craig Cottle Productions and Craig Cottle
results.brief_description: A young girl reacting unhappily to her parents’ recent divorce alienates herself from her girlfriends when she continually fails to attend ballet practice for a school performance. In the meantime, she forms a friendship with an old man who is the caretaker of the local conservatory, and, through him, comes to understand that problems must be confronted rather than avoided if a solution is to be found. Sadly, her friendship with the old man comes to an end with his death. This film raises issues for discussion such as responsibilities towards others, family situations, human relationships, old age and death. Cast includes Roy Witham and Saba Sluyter.

results.title: Destination: science
results.creator_credit: Focal Video, EPCOT Educational Media and Fern Field
results.brief_description: Combines animation and live action as Donald Duck is invited to tour the world of science beyond the laboratory. Flight, the electric light bulb and computers are used to illustrate the relevance of inquiry and discovery in our daily lives. Part of the series “Journey to tomorrow”.

results.title: Destination Australia: the migrant story
results.creator_credit: ScreenSound Australia, Immigration Museum and Lisa Pennock
results.brief_description: A fascinating and comprehensive look at the history of immigration in Australia since 1901 combining excerpt footage from films, newsreels and commercials held within ScreenSound Australia’s Archives and photographs from private collections. The story begins with the Immigration Restriction Act of 1901 and the passing of the White Australia Policy. It continues through to the multiculturalism of the 1970s and the eventual phasing out of that most incongruous White Australia Policy, particularly in the light of Australia’s involvement with Vietnam and our acceptance of the Vietnamese boat people to our shores. Includes footage of child migration; Dunera boys and internees; displaced persons; Bonegilla - Australia’s first holding centre for arriving non-British migrants; 10 pound Poms and “Bring out a Briton” campaign; the Snowy Mountains Scheme; multicultural events as well as many great shots from the past of some of Australia’s historic moments (air raid on Darwin in 1943, the arrival of the Dunera), prominent citizens (Jack Lang, Arthur Calwell, Chips Rafferty) and well-known landscapes (Port Melbourne docks, Sydney Harbour). Introduced by Les Cassidy and narrated by Henri Szeps.

results.title: Destination Australia
results.creator_credit: Film Australia and Australian Institute of Multicultural Affairs
results.brief_description: A series of eight short programmes examining the role of migration in the development of Australia’s nationhood. The titles are: 1. “From gaol to gentry”. 1788-1840. 2. “The Golden land”. 1840-1900. 3. “Growing pains” 1901-1945. 4. “The Widening net”. 1945 onwards. 5. “White Australia policy”. 6. “Who’ll do the dirty work”. 7. “You keep juggling”. 8. “Foreigners”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia and Australian Institute of Multicultural Affairs

results.title: Despotism
results.brief_description: This is the companion piece to the film, “Democracy”. It presents the abstract thesis that power concentrated in the hands of a few, who thus control the means of communication and are able to slant economic distribution in their own favour, and restricted respect of one’s fellow men, are two of the important characteristics of despotism.

results.title: Desperate remedies
results.creator_credit: James Wallace Productions, James H. Wallace, Peter Wells and Stewart Main
results.brief_description: Set in a highly stylised nineteenth century, ‘Desperate Remedies’ powerfully mixes the excitement of a subversive melodrama with the enchantment of historical romance. Set in a nineteenth century colony, it examines a society in which women outmanoeuvre the men. A beautiful woman, Dorothea Brooks, races her buggy down to the wharf. She picks out a handsome immigrant disembarking from a ship. Her quest is simple, almost shocking. She appears to be offering herself, he appears to be pliant and willing. But Dorothea has her feckless younger sister to consider. How can she extricate her from a destructive love affair? This seems to be Dorothea’s problem. ‘Desperate Remedies’ is the story of inhabitants trapped in the nightmarish colonial town called Hope, trying to outwit each other, bargaining, plotting, playing cat and mouse, fighting for what they desire most: all the time poised to accept their own desperate remedy. Cast includes Kevin Smith, Jennifer Ward-Lealand, Lisa Chappell, Kevin Smith and Clifford Curtis and Michael Hurst.
